channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'A virtual strip club': 13 US states sue TikTok over mental health and safety concerns
item.description: Thirteen US states and the District of Columbia have filed lawsuits against TikTok, citing its addictive software and inadequate content moderation for young users. Accusations include operating without licensing for financial transactions and facilitating the sexual exploitation of minors. TikTok disputes the claims, calling them inaccurate and expressing disappointment over the lawsuits.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Joe Biden refers to Trump as 'that f**king a**hole' behind the doors, reveals book
item.description: A new book by Bob Woodward reveals that President Joe Biden privately calls Donald Trump and other world leaders derogatory names, with Trump labeled as "that f**king a**hole." Additionally, Biden criticizes Obama’s handling of the Crimea crisis and uses profanity in private meetings. Kamala Harris was once concerned about Biden's isolation, the book revealed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Strongest Hurricane to hit Tampa Bay in 100 years: Biden issues state of emergency as Milton approaches
item.description: Hurricane Milton, now a Category 4 storm, is threatening Tampa Bay with dangerous winds, heavy rainfall, and potential storm surges up to 15 feet. Florida officials, including Governor Ron DeSantis, have urged residents to evacuate to avoid catastrophic impacts. President Joe Biden has declared a state of emergency while mobilizing federal resources to aid in preparations and response.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sunny Hostin asks Kamala Harris one question. The answer surprises social media
item.description: Kamala Harris said one difference she would have with Joe Biden as president is that she would tap a Republican to serve in her Cabinet -- something that she already announced. But when she was asked if there is something that she would have done differently than President Joe Biden during the past four years, she said there was not a thing on her mind and she was part of most of the decisions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I'm gay and I'm voting for Trump': Ellen DeGeneres faces backlash over 'love vs hate' Instagram post
item.description: Ellen DeGeneres has received criticism for an Instagram post highlighting love and inclusion over hate and violence. Her repost of Jamie Lee Curtis's message sparked debate, especially among Trump supporters. Some users expressed opposition, defending their political choices and accusing celebrities of creating division. The online reaction included strong support for Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris vs Donald Trump: Latest NYT/Sienna poll finds Harris rising
item.description: The latest NYT/Siena poll shows Kamala Harris leading Donald Trump nationally by 49% to 46%, though within the margin of error of the polling. Harris gains support among older voters and even some Republicans; she is also perceived as the change candidate by a wide margin, especially among younger voters. Trump is viewed as a stronger leader on certain issues.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bizarre! Tim Walz reveals name Kamala Harris is listed under on his phone
item.description: The Minnesota Governor traveled to Los Angeles on Monday evening for his late-night debut on Jimmy Kimmel Live! One of the issue they discussed was the call from Kamala Harris that informed him that he was going to be the VP candidate of the Democratic Party. “It was an unmarked number so I’m thinking it’s like a car warranty thing. I got a call from a high ranking aide and said, ‘Pick up your dang phone,’” Walz said as the audience was already laughing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Florida weatherman breaks down on air while reporting about Hurricane Milton
item.description: Meteorologist John Morales became emotional while describing Hurricane Milton's staggering intensity on-air, highlighting the extreme weather driven by global warming. Milton is nearing historic wind speeds with wind gusts surpassing 200 mph, prompting calls for a new category 6 designation. Emergency measures are in place as Florida braces for impact.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump calls Kamala Harris incompetent after '60 Minutes' interview. CBS reveals why Trump backed out
item.description: Donald Trump canceled his interview with CBS's 60 Minutes over disagreements on fact-checking policies. He also demanded an apology from Leslie Stahl, citing an issue from a previous interview. But Trump was quick to diss Kamala Harris's 60 Minutes interview, calling it an embarrassment and questioning her competence in handling natural disaster relief, urging voters to reject her.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: This gun for fire: Kamala goes in Glock Step and Barrel into media blitz
item.description: Kamala Harris openly discusses her Glock ownership and practice at shooting ranges in a CBS 60 Minutes interview, aiming to balance gun control views against Second Amendment rights. The interview addresses her media presence, Trump’s derogatory remarks, and her approach to immigration control.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Melania Trump is King Charles' pen-pal? They first met in 2005
item.description: Melania Trump and Charles first met in New York in 2005 when King Charles was the Prince of Wales. They reunited in 2019 when Melania made a state visit to the UK with Donald Trump who was the president at that time. Melania wrote that it was an "absolute pleasure to reconnect" with Charles. Donald Trump received a private letter from the monarch after the first assassination attempt was made in July in Pennsylvania, during an election rally.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bangladesh extends durga puja holidays amid rising security concerns
item.description: Bangladesh extended Durga Puja holidays to four days, responding to the Hindu community's demands following attacks after Sheikh Hasina's resignation. An executive order ensures the holidays, with government and law enforcement promising security for peaceful celebrations amidst ongoing efforts to maintain communal harmony.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 2024 Nobel prize: John J Hopfield and Geoffrey E Hinton receive Physics award
item.description: John J Hopfield and Geoffrey E Hinton have won the Nobel Prize in Physics 2024 for their pivotal work in machine learning with artificial neural networks. Their innovations allow computers to mimic memory and learning functions, laying the groundwork for contemporary artificial intelligence advancements.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'No stranger to Pennsylvania': Elon Musk reshares old photo of himself after attending Trump rally
item.description: Elon Musk has revealed that he lived in Pennsylvania for three years while attending the University of Pennsylvania. He recently attended a rally with former President Donald Trump and his PAC is backing a petition supporting the First and Second Amendments. Musk graduated with dual degrees from Penn, and launched his first start-up, Zip2, after dropping out of Stanford.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: One mpox case found in Uganda prison, official says
item.description: A case of mpox has been identified in Nakasongola jail, central Uganda. The infected prisoner is isolated and receiving treatment. With Uganda's mpox cases rising to 41, health authorities are concerned given the disease's spread via close contact. The country has secured 2,000 mpox vaccine doses and remains vigilant against Marburg virus from Rwanda.

item.title: Wisconsin teacher faces 10 felony charges for allegedly 'making out' with fifth grader
item.description: Wisconsin teacher Madison Bergmann faces ten felony charges for allegedly sexually assaulting an 11-year-old student and sending over 33,000 explicit text messages. Evidence includes incriminating messages and a folder with handwritten notes found in her classroom. Bergmann resigned after the allegations surfaced and has pleaded not guilty. Further court proceedings are upcoming.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Fall claims lives of five Russian climbers on Nepal's Mount Dhaulagiri
item.description: Five Russian climbers lost their lives on Mount Dhaulagiri during an autumn expedition. Their bodies were found days later by a rescue helicopter, though recovery complications remain. Two of the climbers had reached the summit before communication ceased during descent.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'S-Moo-th Criminal': Thailand's popular pygmy hippo's 'moonwalk' goes viral
item.description: Moo Deng, a pygmy hippo at a Thai zoo, gained viral fame for her moonwalk performance, mimicking Michael Jackson. While her antics delight visitors, zoo officials express concern over harmful behaviour from the crowd, urging better treatment of the animal. Despite her occasionally unfriendly demeanor, Moo Deng continues to captivate global audiences.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 3 killed after an Air Evacuation helicopter crashes in Owen County
item.description: An Air Evac Lifeteam helicopter crashed in Owen County, Kentucky, killing all three crew members on board. The crash occurred while the helicopter was en route to pick up a patient. Authorities have identified the victims and are investigating the incident. Power outages were reported in the area following the crash.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Decapitated, head left on pick-up truck': Mexican mayor murdered 6-days after assuming office
item.description: The mayor of Chilpancingo in southern Mexico was murdered just days after taking office. Alejandro Arcos was decapitated, and his head was discovered on a truck. This follows the killing of city government secretary Francisco Tapia. This violence is part of ongoing cartel-related issues in Guerrero state, where violence against politicians is rising.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
